name: Grand Hotel de la Muse et du Rozier

reviews.text: This hotel is exquisitely situated right on the banks of the River Tarn. It is idyllic. Sadly we did not enjoy our stay for two main reasons.
reviews.title: Beautiful Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One, it was very hot when we were there and there was no airconditioning anywhere and it was hard to escape the heat.
reviews.title: Lovely riverside position, excellent service but expensive drinks

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Secondly, the food. If you are into gourmet food then this is a great place for you. If, like us, you are travelling with children then beware. We had booked the restaurant not knowing it was such haute cuisine and when we asked for something plain for our son, the kitchen found it very hard to comply. Firstly the adult meal with sauce and 'violet artichokes' appeared. Then we politely asked again for just plain beef it came back overcooked with some very strange form of mashed potato. My son ended up dining on the mars bars I had packed that night. I have to say that the staff were quite rude and unhelpful during our meal and it was not a pleasant experience. However there is a solution, just drive for 5 mins into Le Rozier and there are numerous nice cafes and pizza places.
reviews.title: DID NOT LIVE UP TO EXPECTATIONS

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Also be warned that the only help with luggage we were offered was from some petite lady which my husband felt to awkward to accept so we had to lug it all upstairs ourselves.
reviews.title: Excellent food and fab views

reviews.text: This was basically a walking holiday and we were very pleased about the excellent service provided by all staff from the moment we arrived to the day of departure. Our very spacious room had wonderful river and mountain views and was serviced daily to the highest standards.
reviews.title: great stay in superb area

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We chose this hotel because of it's close location to the Millau viaduct and because it looked lovely on the website. We were not disappointed. The location is peaceful on the side of a deep gorge (our room overlooked this lovely view). The hotel is beautifully decorated throughout and our room was spacious and confortable. Customer service and attitude of the staff was great - friendly and helpful. Parking was limited when we stayed because the hotel was full - we had to park further up the road in a seperate car park but we did have a space each night. The evening menu is limited unless you are a francophile and very expensive so we chose to eat out. Out of season there aren't many local places to go but our room and the location more than made up for this. Highly recommended.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel, beautiful location.

likes.liked: — Quality of hotel/room and the location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.title: Location, Location, Location

likes.liked: — Great base for Millau and The Gorge du Tarn
likes.disliked: — Difficult parking; and set-down/pick-up arrangements when hotel is busy.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When The Cyclists Touring Club opened the first hotel on this site in 1896 - it was all about location. Location is still the strongest asset of this stylish contemporary property, making the most of its setting in The Gorge du Tarn, with spacious outdoor areas, a terrace and deck area, private beach, gardens and pool. Rooms are modern, comfortable, and have excellent bathrooms. There's a strong emphasis on food, and the kitchen team produce dishes which try to out-match the scenery for impact. Unfortunately the result can be more style than substance. The breakfast operation didn't seem to receive the same level of attention.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel

reviews.text: This charming and elegant hotel was a delightful surprise. It is modern but fits into its location as if it were always there. The location is central to all the sights of the most impressive Gorge du Tarn without busloads of tourists parking in front of the door.
reviews.title: Classy hotel, wonderful location.

likes.disliked: — Some of the other guests could have been quieter at night.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was spacious with a unique window facing the gorge that jutted out from the wall, which gave a feeling of openness. In addition there was an unusual motorized darkening wall which made it easy to sleep in.
reviews.title: a very relaxing place

likes.liked: — situation was great and lovely room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2005, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Can be difficult to get to, particularly if you take the wrong motorway exit as we did. It was a scenic but very tortuous drive to get there.
reviews.title: Great escape at Millau

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2003, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel itself was in a lovely setting on the banks of a river. We stayed on the top floor and the room was very spacious and modern with a beutiful view over the river. There are good reasonably priced restaurants as short walk from the hotel. The hotel restaurant was also very good. Would rate this as one of the more idyllic hotels that I have stayed at. Hotel has a good swimming pool.
reviews.title: A hidden gem

likes.liked: — It was clean, comfortable and had a balcony with a fantastic view
likes.disliked: — It was just a little dated

reviews.title: Wonderful hotel
reviews.text: I stayed here a few years ago en route back from Spain and wish I'd stayed longer.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A nice hotel in a lovely unspoiled area. Suitable really for anyone interested in cycling, walking , climbing and canoeing.
reviews.title: Peaceful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed 4 nights to see the Millau Bridge - it's about 15 miles from the hotel. 2 nights would have been enough as although Le Rozier is nice there are very few places to eat so we found ourselves travelling to Millau each night.
reviews.title: Wonderful setting, superb dinner

reviews.text: A word of warning - although the food in the hotel is excellent, it is very expensive and a bit too 'haute cuisine' for my 6ft 4 barn door of a partner who could've done with a much, much larger portion. Don't pay the 13 Euro EACH for breakfast - cornflakes, muesli and a few mini croissants are all that's on offer very limited even for a continenal -there's a snack bar just down the road i'd try there.
reviews.title: Terrific!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For those interested in the night sky - very clear nights and the milky way easily seen even to me!
reviews.title: Above-average hotel in beautiful area

likes.disliked: — A bit over-priced (and see my comment about the dog!)

reviews.text: On the whole nice hotel with good rooms - I agree with one of the other reviewers that it isn't as glossy as the website but still nice.
reviews.title: Stunning base near Millau - far, far better than 3 star suggests
